required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Beta2-mimetic and Central Nervous System: Effects of Salbutamol on Cortical Excitability and Cerebral Activation

brief_summary.textblock: Beta2-mimetics such as Salbutamol have been shown to have ergogenic effects. Acute and chronic inhaled or oral doses of Salbutamol have been shown to increase whole body exercise and muscle performances. The underlying mechanisms are however unclear. Some data suggest that Salbutamol may have some effects on the central nervous system which may explain the improved exercise and neuromuscular performances. The present study aims to assess the effects of acite inhaled or oral Salbutamol intake on the neuromuscular system by using neurostimulation techniques and magnetic resonance imaging.

detailed_description.textblock: The effects of Salbutamol intake will be assessed by using transcranial magnetic stimulation on one hand and magnetic resonance imaging on the other hand. Maximal voluntary activation and cerebral activation will be measured during motor tasks performed until exhaustion after acute inhaled slabutamol intake, acture oral salbutamol intake or oral placebo intake.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediatly after treatment intake (within 1 h)
primary_outcome.description: Measurement performed by using transcranial magnetic stimulation, superimposed on submaximal and maximal quadricep contractions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediatly after treatment intake (within 1 h)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement performed by using magnetic resonance imaging and the intensity of the BOLD signal in response to a motor task.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured immediatly after treatment intake (within 1 h)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to exhaustion during the exercise muscle test.

arm_group.description: Acute oral intake of 4 mg Salbutamol
Acute oral intake of a placebo

intervention.description: Acute intake of Albuterol, a beta2-mimetic, either inhaled or oral.
Acute oral intake of a placebo drug

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects without respiratory and cordiovascular diseases
- Male
- Age between 18 and 35
- Trained subjects (>6 hours of physical activity per week)
- Non- or ex-smoker (smoking cessation since at least 1 year)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Respiratory, cardiovascular and metabolic diseases
- Neuromuscular diseases
- thyrotoxicosis, or diabetes treated with insulin
- alcoholism
- MRI contraindication
- TMS contraindication
